Superb Fairy-Wren by Andrew Haysom
“This is a female Superb Fairy-wren photographed in Woodlands Historic Park, Greenvale, in the northern suburbs of Melbourne, Australia. Woodlands Historic Park is rich in birdlife and is only a couple of kilometers from my home.”

title: Into the Woods by Svein Nordrum
text:
Into the Woods by Svein Nordrum
“This shot was taken while hiking in the Lillomarka wood, on the outskirts of Oslo in Norway. The dense fog in the woods this November day created a great mood for photographing!”

title: Dawn @ Tickenham IV by Gary Clark
text:
Dawn @ Tickenham IV by Gary Clark
“After missing so many beautiful misty dawn mornings this week while traveling to work, I decided to get up early and have a go at my first dawn shoot! This was taken on the moors in Tickenham, North Somerset.”

title: Puesta de sol con flamencos… by Francisco Cordero Fernandez
text:
Puesta de sol con flamencos… by Francisco Cordero Fernandez
“I took this picture of flamingoes during sunset on the farm of Veta la Palma, next to Doñana National Park in Spain.”

title: Polar Bear by Sue North
text:
Polar Bear by Sue North
“I took this shot just offshore from Svalbard, Norway, whilst circumnavigating the island in early August. I was one of 20 passengers; all wildlife enthusiasts. We saw 13 bears in all, as well as tonnes of other wildlife.”

title: Etang de Paimpont by David Martinelli
text:
Etang de Paimpont by David Martinelli
“This was taken in the North West of France, just before a storm. A few minutes after I took this, a large wave soaked me completely! But I still love taking photographs by the sea.”

title: In The Land Of The Dragons by Maria Kaimaki
text:
In The Land Of The Dragons by Maria Kaimaki
“Drakolimni (meaning Dragon Lake) is the name of several alpine lakes in northwestern Greece. According to local folktales the lakes used to be inhabited by dragons that fought each other by throwing pines and rocks, creating the peculiar landscape.”

title: Lina by Jens Franke
text:
Lina by Jens Franke
“During my photo shoot with Lina, I decided to try a couple of close-ups in the beautiful autumn sun. I was looking for something extraordinary, and tried different angles and expressions. In this moment, Lina’s hair perfectly complemented her expression.”

title: Richmond Park by Matthew Harris
text:
Richmond Park by Matthew Harris
“This was taken Richmond Park, Surrey. The day couldn’t have been more perfect. As the mist rose up and the sun peered through the trees, I spotted this stag in a perfect situation.”

title: NYC Skyline by Carl Larson
text:
NYC Skyline by Carl Larson
”The Lower Manhattan skyline taken about 30 minutes after sunset from the Brooklyn Bridge Park. This is a very popular spot among cityscape photographers, so I made certain to hit this location during my weekend in New York.“

title: Landmannalaugar by John Freeman
text:
Landmannalaugar by John Freeman
“I took this in the Landmannalaugar region of Iceland during a very wet cycling and photographic tour. With its spectacular colours, unique geological features and constantly-changing light, Landmannalaugar is a paradise for photographers.”

title: Letlive by Tom Joy
text:
Letlive by Tom Joy
“This is the fourth time I’ve photographed Letlive playing live, this time at Leeds Cockpit. Shooting this gig and then joining the crowd helped me to release negative energy that had built up, lifting my mood.”

title: English Springer Spaniel by Tanya Kozlovsky
text:
English Springer Spaniel by Tanya Kozlovsky
“I’m a pet photographer and this is a photo of one of my dogs. I live and work in Moscow, but my family and I love to travel, and we always take our two dogs with us. This shot was taken in Spain.”

title: Stormy Insight by Drew Hopper
text:
Stormy Insight by Drew Hopper
“I’ve had this spot in East Coast of New South Wales, Australia, in mind for a while, but never had the right conditions for a successful image. This time however, I was rewarded with the perfect conditions.”

title: Let Live by Iordanis Keramidas
text:
Let Live by Iordanis Keramidas
“The photo is a result of experiments using ND filters in order to achieve long exposure, so that moving the camera body may have a blurred and artistic result. It was taken on Xylokastro beach in Greece.”

title: Sparrowhawk by Nick Holland
text:
Sparrowhawk by Nick Holland
“This was taken at Alan McFadyen’s fantastic hide set-up near Dumfries. Following a 325 mile drive, I was in the hide from 7.20am. The female appeared regularly between 9.00am and midday, allowing me to take dozens of shots.”

title: By Ralph Matres
text:
By Ralph Matres
“Most people in rural Philippines rely on motorcycles to ferry residents to and from schools, work, and the market. Some plough the routes not served by larger vehicles and attach metal bars at the ends to accommodate extra passengers.”

title: Vigilant by Alfredo Sanchez
text:
Vigilant by Alfredo Sanchez
“This photo was taken in La Paz, Costa Rica. This red-eye leaf frog is an icon in Costa Rica. I used natural light and a white reflector to fill some of the shadows of the frog.”

title: Rocky September Sunset by Darran Dineen
text:
Rocky September Sunset by Darran Dineen
“The was taken in Guileen, East Cork, Ireland. The tide was out and the sunset was vivid, and I ended up taking this shot with the mossy rocks in the foreground.”

title: Getting There by Douglas Knisely
text:
Getting There by Douglas Knisely
“I took this shot on the north side of the Han River in Seoul, South Korea. I saw the beautiful details of this bridge in the fading light and waited for a good subject to come into the scene.”

title: Seal by Mike McKenzie
text:
Seal by Mike McKenzie 
“The shot was taken about one hour after sunrise when the grey seals were becoming active. Taken from a low point of view, I waited until the seal awoke and started to stretch.”

title: The Naked and Famous by Nan Palmero
text:
The Naked and Famous by Nan Palmero
“This is Thom Powers from The Naked and Famous, a band from New Zealand. I shot there as a Samsung Imagelogger, where we are provided their newest cameras to use pre-launch.”

title: Downton Vancouver by Xavier Wiechers
text:
Downton Vancouver by Xavier Wiechers 
“I took three exposures of this scene and post processed the image to HDR. In the final shot, the traffic in the foreground was too distracting, so I did a motion blur effect in Photoshop.”

title: Julie by Dvix
text:
Julie by Dvix
“This photo was taken during a fairly intense storm that had blown the power out in the cabin we were in. About an hour after this photo was taken, the cabin was actually torn apart by a fallen tree!”

title: Costa Occidental by José María Franco López
text:
Costa Occidental by José María Franco López
“This was taken in Cabo Busto, Asturias, Northern Spain. I wanted to take a shot of the wind and clouds with a very long exposure. This was the result.”

title: Wind by Tobias Schenk
text:
Wind by Tobias Schenk
“This was taken in a Prague metro station. My friend and I were on a sightseeing trip, but the rain was constant. So we decided to take some indoor shots to stay dry, and captured this shot in the underground.”

title: Divine Morning II by Zaw Wai
text:
Divine Morning II by Zaw Wai
“This was a magical and divine morning, as the gentle rays of morning light revealed the silhouette of the ancient Buddhist Temple of Borobudur, Indonesia.”

title: By Gioacchino Petronicce
text:
By Gioacchino Petronicce
“This photography was shot during summer in Hossegor, France. There was a man who was enjoying the challenging waves. I wanted shoot this man against the wall of water to represent loneliness.”

title: Champignons du soir… by Valérie Badan
text:
Champignons du soir… by Valérie Badan
“A friend of mine invited my to ‘mushroom photo session’.  We went to a wood near where we live in Switzerland, by Lake Geneva. It was the end of the day, giving some nice lights and colors.”

title: Friendship in Tofino by Tara Romasanta
text:
Friendship in Tofino by Tara Romasanta
“This was taken in Tofino, Canada, during a trip with my photographer friends. I couldn’t resist the silhouettes of these two on the rocks at Chesterman beach, asked them to hold hands.”

title: Richmond Park Deer by Raphaël Jourdan
text:
Richmond Park Deer by Raphaël Jourdan
“I’d been watching this deer for several days. I took this in the morning when there was a lot of fog, giving this shot a particular atmosphere.”

title: By Jesus Mendez
text:
By Jesus Mendez
“This was taken in Crevillente, Alicante, Spain. It shows an 18th century aqueduct called Els Pontets (The Bridges), which was restored recently.”

title: Tall & Proud by Diane Lassaline
text:
Tall & Proud by Diane Lassaline
“I am addicted to dandelions so am always on the lookout for these little miracles popping up in my own yard. I love close-ups and rarely change my lens for anything else.”

title: Amanece que no es poco by Rubén Toquero
text:
Amanece que no es poco by Rubén Toquero
“This picture is taken in Costanova, Portugal, during sunset. We were walking along the sea shore, and as we saw the red light in the sky we came to the boardwalk to capture silhouette shots.”

title: Katmai Bears by Richard McManus
text:
Katmai Bears by Richard McManus
“These two bears were fighting over a dead moose in Katmai National Park, Alaska. They were like boxers and would have a rest every few minutes. The whole thing lasted over an hour. The bear on the left was defeated.”

title: Midi á Midi B/N by Cruz Vicente
text:
Midi á Midi B/N by Cruz Vicente
“The photograph shows the Midi D'Ossau peak – one of the most beautiful in the Pyrenees. It was at noon, but a leaden skies filtered the light. I thought that it was a good moment to take a picture.”

title: Egypt by Sébastien Mamy
text:
Egypt by Sébastien Mamy
“This morning on the Nile, the conditions were perfect for taking pictures. I was waiting for sunrise I saw a king fisher flying along the surface of the river. The soft colours and the blurred reflection made the shot.”

title: Speed Night by Marta Errea
text:
Speed Night by Marta Errea
“This was taken on Gran Vía street, Madrid. I wanted to express the bustle of a big city centre at night. I used a tripod, a remote trigger and off-camera flash.”

title: White Pocket Lightning by Andrew Waddington
text:
White Pocket Lightning by Andrew Waddington
“This is the lesser-known White Pockets at Arizona’s Vermillion Cliffs – you need a powerful 4WD to reach here. I shot this as a summer monsoon passed through late in the afternoon.”

title: Pushing On by Stephen Boote
text:
Pushing On by Stephen Boote
“The shot was taken on the Great Gable in the Lake District, England. A low cloud had ruined most of the day, so I was fortunate to grab this interlude before it came rolling back in again.”

title: Early Forest by David Baker
text:
Early Forest by David Baker
“This was taken at Puckpits in the New Forest, Hampshire, UK, a little after dawn. It’s part of a photographic project called ‘Ridge Trees’ which explores a small area of the forest at dawn and in misty conditions.”

title: The Mosque (Reflections) by Achim Thomae
text:
The Mosque (Reflections) by Achim Thomae
“The image was taken during my trip to Abu Dhabi. A highlight of this trip was the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque. I spent a lot of time within this architectural masterpiece with wonderful light and symmetries.”

title: Polar Bear and Me by Peter Meijer
text:
Polar Bear and Me by Peter Meijer
“This was taken at Blijdorp Zoo in Rotterdam, Netherlands. This little girl was watching a bear playing with an object, and something in the look of the girl struck me.”

title: Morteratsch by Sandro Zanetti
text:
Morteratsch by Sandro Zanetti
“The picture was taken in the Morteratsch Glacier, Switzerland, right before sunrise. In the background you see the glacier and the Bernina area, with the highest mountain in the region of Graubünden.”

title: Passion by Sonia Masarova
text:
Passion by Sonia Masarova
“I took this photo at my local beach at Cronulla, south of Sydney, at the end of a very stormy day, which produced an incredible sunset.”

title: Kimi by Brendan Gara
text:
Kimi by Brendan Gara
“I shot this portrait in a studio, lighting the model with a shoot-through umbrella to the right at head height, and a 60cm gridded beauty dish in front and above. Shooting at 90mm is always very flattering.”

title: The Hunt for the Red October by Kevin Evans-Jones
text:
The Hunt for the Red October by Kevin Evans-Jones
“This was taken on the North Yorkshire moors. I attached my camera to a tripod, put out some nuts, and waited. Within minutes the squirrels made an appearance and were soon feeding even from our hands.”

title: Bison in the mist by Sébastien Mamy
text:
Bison in the mist by Sébastien Mamy
“Early in the morning, bisons of Yellowstone National Park gather in large herds. Benefiting from the morning myst to create a dramatic atmosphere, I was looking for bisons crossing the river. This male arrived and crossed the water. A perfect moment.”

title: Stargazing with the Moai by Ben Leshchinsky
text:
Stargazing with the Moai by Ben Leshchinsky
“The true magic of the Easter Island Moai come to life after the sun has set. This moment was incredible, giving us a glimpse into what it may have been like hundreds of years ago when these monuments were constructed.”

title: ISSUE 58 OF PHOTOGRAPHY WEEK IS OUT NOW FOR iPAD AND iPHONE!
text:
ISSUE 58 OF PHOTOGRAPHY WEEK IS OUT NOW FOR iPAD AND iPHONE!
Take out a risk-free trial subscription and get your first five issues FREE at http://goo.gl/BBkmxR.

title: Hvalsneskirkja by Asmundur Þorkelsson
text:
Hvalsneskirkja by Asmundur Þorkelsson
“This is Starneskirkja, a church near Sandgerði, Iceland built in 1886. This is composed of two exposures, which I combined in Photoshop, where I also adjusted curves, levels, and selective colours.”

title: Danielle by Brian Rickey
text:
Danielle by Brian Rickey
“As the sun was setting over a grassy hill, I told Danielle to walk toward her horse. It was the movement of her hands gently over the grass as she walked towards her beautiful horse that caught my attention here.”

title: To Surf, or Not to Surf, That is the Question by Rob Kints
text:
To Surf, or Not to Surf, That is the Question by Rob Kints
“This was shot on South Beach, The Hague. I wanted to shoot silhouettes of surfers against the sun, but the waves weren’t good. When I was about to go, this surfer came onto the scene, and I took this shot.”

title: Pine Siskin by Matt Bango
text:
Pine Siskin by Matt Bango
“The Pine Siskin is a rare winter visitor to New Jersey. I happened to find a flock of them feeding at Liberty State Park, just across the Hudson river from Manhattan.”

title: Golden Coins by Rhonda Martin
text:
Golden Coins by Rhonda Martin
“I set the camera on the tripod with the lens facing down at a 45% angle to the ground. After pressing the shutter, I gently lifted the bottom of the camera up to get the vertical blur.”

title: Ronik by Ivan Dostál
text:
Ronik by Ivan Dostál
“This was taken on my first day with a new camera. I took this photograph of my friend’s dog to create a wallpaper for his desktop. I chose a plain background and used a shallow depth of field.”

title: Light and Isolation at Middle Velma Lakes, Desolation Wilderness by Christian Arballo
text:
Light and Isolation at Middle Velma Lakes, Desolation Wilderness by Christian Arballo
“I took this above Emerald Bay at Lake Tahoe, California. The spot we found was absolutely perfect and the view was stunning. Middle Velma has micro islands and is a perfect spot to backpack.”

title: Zest by Sharon Stevens
text:
Zest by Sharon Stevens
“This image of Zest – my best friend’s dressage horse. Having first slowly introduced the flashes and softbox to him, he seemed quite unphased and happily stood posing for us.”

title: Ridge Trail Sunrise by Marc Crumpler
text:
Ridge Trail Sunrise by Marc Crumpler
“Taken at Black Diamond Mines Regional Preserve in Antioch, California.There was smoke drifting overhead from a fire burning on Mt. Diablo, so I travelled to this location to photograph this scene while the sun was low on the horizon.”

title: Dead End Cliff by Tommy Johansen
text:
Dead End Cliff by Tommy Johansen
“This was taken at Nesland in the Lofoten Islands, Norway. The weather had been grey for days, and the light was flat, so I used an ND filter and a long exposure.”

title: Moving Rock by Rawin Cheasagul
text:
Moving Rock by Rawin Cheasagul
“Racetrack Playa is one of the famous places in Death Valley National Park. To capture the moving rocks and their trails, light from the sunrise was needed to create long shadows and increase the details of the trails.”

title: Haukadalur í Dýrafirði by Bernhardur Gudmundsson
text:
Haukadalur í Dýrafirði by Bernhardur Gudmundsson
“This photo was captured in Westfjords, Iceland after a harsh winter storm with heavy snowfall in the mountains. There was a moment of serenity as the sun came up, which was wonderful for animals and humans alike.”

title: Stars Whirlpool by Rawin Cheasagul
text:
Stars Whirlpool by Rawin Cheasagul
“This was taken in Yosemite National Park, showing the Upper and Lower Yosemite Falls. I used a very long exposure, and bright moonlight to capture both star trails and the dead tree in the foreground.”

title: Floating II by Emiliano Iko
text:
Floating II by Emiliano Iko
“This was taken in the sea of Croatia while swimming with a friend of mine one cloudy morning. The underwater Nikon Coolpix camera had water on the lens, causing the blur at the edges.”

title: Morning in the Mountains by Gabriel Marian
text:
Morning in the Mountains by Gabriel Marian
“I took this in June in Vama village in Romania. I was traveling with a friend to catch the sunrise in the mountains. On the way, we stopped the village at about 3.30am to capture the atmosphere of the moment.”

title: Bare Mountain by Andreas Christensen
text:
Bare Mountain by Andreas Christensen
“This was from a mountain hike to Kjerag, at Lysefjorden in Norway. The highest point is 1,110 metres above sea level. Being so close to the clouds creates a great show play on the mountain tops.”

title: Common Blue Butterfly by Martyn Hall
text:
Common Blue Butterfly by Martyn Hall
“I found a small colony of the Common Blue butterfly on a walk alongside the Huntspill River in Somerset, UK. As long as you don’t move to suddenly, they are more than happy to pose for the camera.”

title: Alvida Juma Twighlight at Jama Masjid by Nimit Nigam
text:
Alvida Juma Twighlight at Jama Masjid by Nimit Nigam
“Alvida Juma is the last Friday of the holy month of Ramadan. Muslims here are gathered around Jama Masjid mosque in New Delhi, India.”

title: Red Fox by John Crawford
text:
Red Fox by John Crawford
“This red fox visits our garden most nights.I’d put some scraps of food out and sat in my hide, waiting for her to come. I was able to capture her yawning as she settled down for a snooze.”

title: Hana by Akimasa Harada
text:
Hana by Akimasa Harada
“This is Hana, a member of my Cat Cafe ‘Miaw’ in Japan. Her jumping is incredible, and I’m best able to capture it using manual focus.”

title: Kilchurn Castle, Scotland by Trevor Cotton
text:
Kilchurn Castle, Scotland by Trevor Cotton
“The day began with poor visibility and rain. I crossed a bog to reach this view point, and with one hand holding an umbrella chose a long exposure to add softness to the low cloud shrouding the mountains.”

title: By Tim Wu
text:
By Tim Wu
“This picture – taken in northern Tainan, Taiwan – is from a series of female portraits called ‘Scent’. In the series, it’s my goal to capture and represent beauty and emotions.”

title: The Glacier (Purple) by Achim Thomae
text:
The Glacier (Purple) by Achim Thomae
“This was taken during a weekend trip to the Weisssee-Glacier in Austria. The High Tauern National Park is a fascinating place – a spectacular, colourful alpine landscape with a lot of photo opportunities.”

title: Through the Reeds by Adrian Campfield
text:
Through the Reeds by Adrian Campfield
“This is my local river – the Darenth – that runs through the Crayford marshes in Bexley, Kent, England. There are always birds that use the river such as this grey heron, hunting the rivers edge for fish.”

title: The Corpse by Eve North
text:
The Corpse by Eve North
“I took this in the grounds of an old country home in Ireland. We were out for hours and I didn’t capture anything I fell in love with, but just as we were about to head home, I snapped this.”

title: By Joe Eisner
text:
By Joe Eisner 
“This is a photo of a young skateboarder taken at Venice Beach, LA. This a popular tourist and photography site and many people come to check out the skateboarders, especially during the summer months.”

title: Fatima by Jontxu Fernandez
text:
Fatima by Jontxu Fernandez
“This photo was taken in the Sanctuary of Our Lady of Fatima, in Portugal. The light was perfect when a I saw a sister upstairs and other group of sisters downstairs, and I felt that it was the right moment.”

title: Setting Moon by David Briard
text:
Setting Moon by David Briard 
“I came to the beach early in the morning to photograph the sunset, but when I saw that the sea was completely calm, with the full moon hanging on the horizon, I felt very lucky to be able to capture this scene.”

title: El paso by Maria
text:
El paso by Maria
“The photo was taken from a twelve floor terrace in Torrenueva in Granada, Spain. I liked the road markings and thought it would look great if someone walked into frame, so I simply waited for someone to cross.”

title: Little Owl (Athene Noctua) by Phil Winter
text:
Little Owl (Athene Noctua) by Phil Winter
“I used five flash guns set to 1/16th power to give me plenty of speed to freeze the bird in the air. I got three frames in focus thanks, to the small aperture and wide angle lens.”

title: Mossy Middle by Ray Jennings
text:
Mossy Middle by Ray Jennings
“Merimbula is a small town located in New South Wales, Australia. The town boasts five main beaches, which offer some wonderful opportunities for seascape photography, but by far the best is Middle beach, pictured here.”

title: Brighton Pavilion at Sunset by Kevin Meredith
text:
Brighton Pavilion at Sunset by Kevin Meredith
“This is the Royal Pavilion in Brighton, UK. When the sky turned this colour I had to take a few shots. I underexposed the picture by half a stop to make the blacks really black.”

title: Racquet Tailed Roller by Doris Rapp
text:
Racquet Tailed Roller by Doris Rapp
“This colorful racquet-tailed roller is one of the native African birds featured in the aviary of the Expedition Congo: African Forest section of the Columbus Zoo and Aquarium located in Columbus, Ohio.”

title: Waves by John Harrison
text:
Waves by John Harrison
“I took this picture through a window in the John Hancock Building in Chicago. From here, sometimes I’m above the clouds, sometimes in the clouds, and sometimes below them.”

title: Fencepost at Sunset by Michael James
text:
Fencepost at Sunset by Michael James
“This was taken east of Camrose in Alberta, Canada as part of a timelapse sequence. I often go through the sequences I shoot to see if there are any images that can be taken out and used on their own.”

title: Mr. Blue Jeans by Hali Sowle
text:
Mr. Blue Jeans by Hali Sowle
“This photo of a strawberry poison dart frog was taken in Costa Rica during a photography workshop. We were lucky enough to find quite a few of these tiny amphibians on the grounds of our lodging.”

title: Mirrored Mural Moment by David Ingraham
text:
Mirrored Mural Moment by David Ingraham
“This mural in LA is by Robert Vargas. I wanted to do more than just take a snapshot. After stepping into the street and seeing the reflection in a parked car, I waited for someone to walk into the scene.”

title: Reflection by Rungkit Charoenwat
text:
Reflection by Rungkit Charoenwat
“This is the Black Dragon Pool in Lijiang city, in Yunnan province. I shot with the camera low to the water, using an ND filter to get a clear reflection of Jade Dragon Snow mountain.”

title: Dahlia Close Up by Charles Bonham
text:
Dahlia Close Up by Charles Bonham
“This is a photo of a dahlia flower taken at a local community garden called Dahlia Hill in Midland, Michigan, USA. I wanted to try out my new Olympus 60mm macro lens on the dahlias in full bloom.”

title: Mount Shimen by Pan Chung
text:
Mount Shimen by Pan Chung
“I really like to shoot stars against natural landscapes. This photo shows Mount Shimen, part of the Hehuan Hills in Taiwan. This was my third time shooting here, at a height of over 3000 meters.”

title: The Storm is Coming by Jirawas Teekayu
text:
The Storm is Coming by Jirawas Teekayu
“This picture was taken from one of the high-rise buildings in Bangkok. A storm was on its way and I could see that the rain had already fallen on the other side of the city.”

title: Fisherman vs Cat by Julien Ballet-Baz
text:
Fisherman vs Cat by Julien Ballet-Baz
“Istanbul is actually a city of water, and a city of cats. I was enjoying time watching the fishermen when I saw a few cats waiting to steal fish, and I knew I could get an interesting shot of this!”

title: Snow by Eve North
text:
Snow by Eve North
“This is a portrait of a girl that I met at an exhibition. She captivated me from across the room and we became fast friends. This was taken at a nature reserve near to where I live in Ireland.”

title: Dusk over the North west Fells by Terry Roberts
text:
Dusk over the North west Fells by Terry Roberts
“This was taken from the top of Red Pike in the northwest of the English Lake District, showing the lakes of Crummock Water on the left and Buttermere on the right.”

title: A beautiful clear sky…nothing but stars! by Catherine Hammer
text:
A beautiful clear sky…nothing but stars! by Catherine Hammer
“This was created using 11 images and merging them together to create star trails. I had varying degrees of light painting on the tree in four of the images.”

title: L'escargot by Scott Baldcock
text:
L'escargot by Scott Baldcock
“This is a shot of the Heals Store staircase in Tottenham Court Road, London. I processed this in Lightroom 4 for a colour version and then in made a black and white version in Silver Efex Pro 2.”

title: Shores of Île d'Orléans by Carol Persons
text:
Shores of Île d'Orléans by Carol Persons
“This is a self-portrait taken in Quebec City on the Shores of Île d'Orléans. While driving around the island I spotted this washed up boat and had to shoot with it.”

title: Camouflage by Mo
text:
Camouflage by Mo
“This was taken in Chefchaouen, a village in Morocco. I noticed this man sitting here, and was struck by how perfectly the colours of his clothes matched the environment.”

title: Sunset Stroll by Helen Ogbourn
text:
Sunset Stroll by Helen Ogbourn
“Walking on Penhors beach in Brittany, France, I noticed how the sun’s light stretched onto a small strip of sand for a few seconds each time a wave lapped the shore. I shot at a low angle to capture this.”

title: The Old Lifeboat House by William Razzell
text:
The Old Lifeboat House by William Razzell
“I have visited Newquay in the UK several times so when there was a rapidly passing storm in the evening I knew that this spot, overlooking the Fistral headland, would be great for when the clouds began to clear.”

title: Great Crested Grebe by Paul McMullen
text:
Great Crested Grebe by Paul McMullen
“I got to the lake very early and waited until the mist lifted to capture this great crested grebe just as I’d hoped, shooting low to the water.”

title: The Thatcher by Peter Delaney
text:
The Thatcher by Peter Delaney
“This was taken in the Giants Castle region of KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. This woman’s husband had died the previous year, and she was cutting this thatch to repair the roof of her home.”

title: Hypnotising Eyes by Chris Frank
text:
Hypnotising Eyes by Chris Frank
“I took this in South Tyrol near Merano, Italy, where there is a wild bird refuge. They put on a bird show, which gave me the opportunity to take this shot as an owl from the refuge flew by.”

title: Sunfall by Jamie Frith
text:
Sunfall by Jamie Frith
“This is a picture of my wife, Elyse. I didn’t want the highlights blown out, so I positioned her with the sun out of frame, creating an amazing golden light shining through her hair.”

title: Superbaby by Isabel Cortes Parra
text:
Superbaby by Isabel Cortes Parra
“This is one of the photos of my little son, taken for a project of his first months. It was taken on the bed, with home clothes to make the composition.”

title: The Pair by Paul Vecsei
text:
The Pair by Paul Vecsei
“I took this at a small stream in British Columbia. I waited for over half an hour for the salmon to get used to me, but it was worth it as this pair came close by.”

title: Silver Lining by Rohan Reilly
text:
Silver Lining by Rohan Reilly
“I took this shot in Carlow, West Cork, Ireland. I’d been out shooting seascapes, but as the mist rose in this field behind me, I knew I had to make the most of this photo opportunity.”

title: The Red Dot by Jared Lim
text:
The Red Dot by Jared Lim
“I took this shot during my holiday in Peru while I was in a small plane flying over the Nazca Desert. I was lucky enough to see this striking red car driving alone along the Pan American Highway.”

title: Pyramid First Light by Chris Tostevin-Hall
text:
Pyramid First Light by Chris Tostevin-Hall
“I took this shot of Pyramid Lake just before 8am, just west of Jasper, Alberta. I waited until most of the early morning mist cleared, leaving this remaining misty cloud to add to the ambience of the scene.”

title: White Wolf by Heather Allen
text:
White Wolf by Heather Allen
“This grey wolf was taken at Woodland Park Zoo in Seattle. I took the shot as the wolves were being fed small fish. This wolf was the beta of the pack and hung back a little.”

title: Shadows by Stavros Stamatiou
text:
Shadows by Stavros Stamatiou
“This was taken late in the afternoon outside the small Orthodox church of Agia Marina, in the village of Myrsini, Greece.”

title: Neck Deep by Gary Seloff
text:
Neck Deep by Gary Seloff
“This shot of a green heron was captured from my kayak in an undeveloped area of the Armand Bayou Nature Center, southeast of Houston, Texas. The bayou supports a healthy population of fish as well as a variety of birds.”

title: Fire Dancer by Graham Crumb
text:
Fire Dancer by Graham Crumb
“A member of the Vanua Fire Dance Group performs at a resort in Port Vila, Vanuatu in the South Pacific.”

title: Issue 49 out now for iPad AND iPhone!
text:
Issue 49 out now for iPad AND iPhone!
Take a back-yard safari with this issue’s feature, which is packed with advice on getting amazing shots of everything from butterflies and bugs to flowers and frogs, all without leaving your garden. The tips and techniques are guaranteed to help you improve your nature shots this weekend!

title: Volcano in Hawaii by Alain Barbezat
text:
Volcano in Hawaii by Alain Barbezat
“This was taken on Hawaii’s Big Island, where this volcano was active. After a four hour drive and hiking on challenging terrain, we got to this view point. I was able to capture this epic battle between water and fire.”

title: Gypsy Boys by Isac Goulart
text:
Gypsy Boys by Isac Goulart
“This was taken at a gypsy camp in Brazil. Once the kids here saw my camera, they just wanted to be in front of the camera. I got a few fantastic shots, which I printed and gave them each a copy.”

title: Curiosity by Gabriel Marian
text:
Curiosity by Gabriel Marian
“This cat was owned by some of my neighbours after it was abandoned as a kitten. Almost every day it came to sit on the balcony from the second floor of my building in Suceava, Romania.”

title: Star in a Storm by Hugo Marques
text:
Star in a Storm by Hugo Marques
“This was taken at Praia Azul in Santa Cruz, Portugal. On this day the sun set combined with a low tide created the perfect opportunity to photograph this starfish.”

title: Tragopogon Orientalis by Ewa Ciebiera
text:
Tragopogon Orientalis by Ewa Ciebiera
“I took this in a meadow near Morges in Switzerland. I photographed this dandelion (Latin name tragopogon orientalis) against a piece of plastic bag, which created a nice blue background.”

title: Warp Speed by Darren Neupert
text:
Warp Speed by Darren Neupert
“I decided to stop on my way out of Mount Rainier National Park to take this one last shot. It is a composite consisting of a normal exposure, and one where I slowly rotated the aperture ring.”

title: Issue 48 out now for iPad AND iPhone!
text:
Issue 48 out now for iPad AND iPhone!
Want to transform your images overnight without spending a small fortune? Then this week’s feature has the answer: it takes you step by step through the five essential filters that every photographer should own, from circular polarisers to graduated neutral density filters. We look at what they’re for, how to use them, and just why they’re so important.

title: Heart of the Navajo by Darren Neupert
text:
Heart of the Navajo by Darren Neupert
“The walls of Lower Antelope Canyon, in Page, Arizona, can show the most brilliant colors early in the morning as they catch the sun.”

title: A New Day by Matteo Zanvettor
text:
A New Day by Matteo Zanvettor
“This spectacular view of the Odle (in the Dolomites mountain range) was taken in northern Italy. I captured this image in the early hours of the morning, taking advantage of the particular formation of clouds and light.”

title: Fisherman by Saravut Whanset
text:
Fisherman by Saravut Whanset
“This was taken in the Wanonniwas district in Sakolnankhon province, Thailand, where fishing is a common occupation for most families.”

title: Ha Long Junk by Michael Rainwater
text:
Ha Long Junk by Michael Rainwater
“We’d spent the night on a tourist junk in a sheltered cove in Ha Long Bay, Vietnam.  Shortly after dawn, I went to the roof deck to have a look around and spotted this boat under sail passing us.”

title: Intense Look by Dinesh Babu
text:
Intense Look by Dinesh Babu
“This was taken in Hanumanthapuram village, in Tamilnadu, India. I saw this colourful background and wanted to add an human element, then I saw this girl climbing on the stairs, so I made the most of this photo opportunity.”

title: Surfing Liquid Copper by David Orias
text:
Surfing Liquid Copper by David Orias
“To capture this shot, I used a slow shutter speed and panned the camera with the motion of the surfer. This had created the texture of the wave. The red color was thanks to a vibrant sunrise.”

title: Balloon Launch in Cappadocia by Michael Morris
text:
Balloon Launch in Cappadocia by Michael Morris
“I took the image in Cappadocia, Turkey. Each morning at dawn dozens of balloons are launched here. This was a challenging shot to take, as we were in a rapidly ascending balloon in a low light situation.”

title: A Little Slice of Havana by Liban Yusuf
text:
A Little Slice of Havana by Liban Yusuf
“I love photographing Havana after the sun has set. I’ve been roaming around the city at night for the last nine years, discovering dark little streets that are filled with a soulful serenity.”

title: Bloom by Paul Aparicio
text:
Bloom by Paul Aparicio
“This photo was taken walking through the Dahlia Garden in Golden Gate Park, San Francisco. I was quickly drawn to the distinct shape of this flower and wanted to capture how it appeared to be blooming before my eyes.”

title: Green Grasshopper by Robert Trevis-Smith
text:
Green Grasshopper by Robert Trevis-Smith
“This  is common green grasshopper covered with water droplets. I also used water drops for the surface and background and isolated the grasshopper in the shot using a shallow depth of field.”

title: Sandbox by Achim Tomae
text:
Sandbox by Achim Tomae
“The photo was taken in the Rub al Khali Desert near Abu Dhabi, UAE early in the morning. The colours here change every minute after sunrise.”

title: Full of Colours by Dinesh Babu
text:
Full of Colours by Dinesh Babu
“This was taken in Thiruvalangadu village, near Thiruvallur, Tamilnadu, India. I went for a walk around temple, and on the way I found this little girl, Lakshmi, playing with her sister.”

title: The Lion King by Ania Tuzel
text:
The Lion King by Ania Tuzel
“I went to South Africa with the dream of seeing the Kalahari Lion. On the last day this lion appeared out of nowhere. He walked a few yards, looked at us, and then was gone as quickly as he’d appeared.”

title: Relaxing in Rio by Isac Goulart
text:
Relaxing in Rio by Isac Goulart 
“I took this on Ipanema beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. What’s wonderful about the beaches here is that there’s always something to photograph: people playing soccer or volleyball, surfers, couples walking… I fell in love with Rio that day.”

title: Waiting by Alex Greenshpun
text:
Waiting by Alex Greenshpun
“I took this while waiting for a train. It was early in the morning on a very foggy day. I found the atmosphere and slow moments around me fascinating, and luckily had my camera with me to capture them.”

title: Cape Hatteras Lighthouse by Danny Collado
text:
Cape Hatteras Lighthouse by Danny Collado
“Taken on Hatteras Island, North Carolina. While the family played on the beach I took a little walk with my camera and spotted the Hatteras lighthouse over the dunes. The sky is courtesy of Tropical Storm Andrea.”

title: Smelly Feet by Alida Jorissen
text:
Smelly Feet by Alida Jorissen
“This is a ring-tailed lemur at Olmense Zoo. I took this photo because it looks like he has smelly feet – we like to humanise animals, and this is very easy to do with lemurs.”

title: Out on the Bayou by Michelle Morris
text:
Out on the Bayou by Michelle Morris
“This image was taken at Black Bayou Wildlife Refuge in Northeast Louisiana. This is a popular spot for local photographers and nature lovers, and on this foggy morning I was lucky to capture another photographer doing what he loves.”

title: Coyote Pup by Mark Perry
text:
Coyote Pup by Mark Perry
“I was photographing a log cabin in Grand Teton National Park in Wyoming when five coyotes pups suddenly appeared from underneath the cabin and started playing. This pup posed for me on the porch of the cabin.”

title: Giants of the Dark by Dani Diamond
text:
Giants of the Dark by Dani Diamond
“In order to capture the perfect tide level and clouds I went back to this location three days in a row. On the third night conditions were perfect. This is a composition of three images: sky, buildings and water.”

title: Melissa by Alina Esther
text:
Melissa by Alina Esther
“This is my cat, Melissa. I find her very photogenic – she always sticks her tongue out, which gives her a certain charm. I just love to photograph her!”

title: Westminster by James Cooper
text:
Westminster by James Cooper
“Using a tripod I wanted to capture the light trails left by buses on Westminster bridge with the iconic Big Ben in the background. I managed to get a clear shot with no other traffic except the bus passing.”

title: Caterpillar by Hee Jenn Wei
text:
Caterpillar by Hee Jenn Wei
“This caterpillar is covered in rain drops as it sat munching on leaves. This was taking at night after rainfall, in the jungle of Malaysia.”

title: Bare Island Blues by Jay Daly
text:
Bare Island Blues by Jay Daly
“This is a shot of Bare Island in Sydney’s Le Perouse. One clear morning I thought I’d try for something different and opted for a long exposure to smooth out the water and soften the morning light.”

title: The Bridge by David Bouchat
text:
The Bridge by David Bouchat
“This is my 1960 Chevrolet Bel Air. As we both live five minutes away from Golden Gate Bridge, my buddy and I decided to try out his new large format camera. The result was this shot.”

title: Fish Special by Claire Marshall
text:
Fish Special by Claire Marshall
“This image was taken near Leeds in the UK from a hide set up to allow people to photograph kingfishers. It was 6.30am and this female started her day with the biggest fish she could find.”

title: Homestretch by George Hendrix
text:
Homestretch by George Hendrix
“The shot was taken in August last year at the regular Thursday evening summer rodeo in Carbondale, Colorado. This girl was just 13 at the time and finished a run in junior barrel racing.”

title: Rear View Monument Valley by Jeff Clow
text:
Rear View Monument Valley by Jeff Clow
“I was aware of the view at mile marker 13 north of Monument Valley and wanted to craft something different, so I used my rear view mirror as a framing device.”

title: The Observer by Howard Snyder
text:
The Observer by Howard Snyder
“Sunset at Mount Hood from Trillium Lake in Oregon. This is an amazing photographic subject you don’t have to hike miles to reach, making Mount Hood a very popular amongst photographers in the Pacific Northwest.”

title: Burrowing Owl by Cindy Bryant
text:
Burrowing Owl by Cindy Bryant
“I took this shot of a Burrowing Owl in Cape Coral, Florida. I got a brief moment when the clouds opened up just enough to light the scene, providing me with a magic moment to capture this shot.”

title: Amina by Francesco Golla
text:
Amina by Francesco Golla
“‘Anima’ is Italian for ‘soul’. I came to Praia de Adraga beach in Portugal more than six years ago and was haunted by a sense of solitude and peace. I returned to capture this in my photography.”

title: Tale of a terminal - A solitary thought by Rahat Amin
text:
Tale of a terminal - A solitary thought by Rahat Amin
“I was struck by this kid’s distinctive posture as he stood looking at the train. I got the impression that he was deep in thought and felt compelled to take this photograph.”

title: Daybreak in Canyonlands by Marc Perella
text:
Daybreak in Canyonlands by Marc Perella
“Dawn breaking at Canyonlands National Park, Moab, Utah. As the sun emerged, the underside of Mesa Arch took on a spectacular orange glow. A typical morning has dozens of photographers just waiting for that perfect moment.”

title: Dragonfly by Paul Christopher Taylor
text:
Dragonfly by Paul Christopher Taylor
“One late afternoon I noticed a group of dragonflies gathering around a flowering bush on my front lawn. The lighting was beautiful so I quickly ran inside to retrieve my camera, then returned to the scene to capture this shot.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Prairie Fire by Wesley Fortin
text:
Prairie Fire by Wesley Fortin
“This image is comprised of two exposures; one of the sky and one of the barn and wheat in the foreground. I blended them together in Photoshop, painting in the sky to match the exposure of the barn.”

title: Bald Eagle vs Sea Lion by Brad Oliver
text:
Bald Eagle vs Sea Lion by Brad Oliver
“This sea lion had been playing with a fish it had caught when a bald eagle saw an opportunity to steal it. As the eagle made its getaway the sea lion leapt out of the water in an attempt to retrieve it.”

title: Palouse Falls by Jason Hatfield
text:
Palouse Falls by Jason Hatfield
“I captured the stunning Palouse Falls in Washington after an all night drive from the Columbia River Gorge. My lack of sleep was rewarded with diffuse golden morning light, making my long exposure image sing.”

title: Coastal Brown Bear by Tin Man Lee
text:
Coastal Brown Bear by Tin Man Lee
“This brown bear is salmon hunting in Katmai National Park, Alaska. I crouched down with water up to my chest to be on eye level with the bear. It took me four hours in the water to capture this shot.”

title: Puffin Landscape by Richard Steel
text:
Puffin Landscape by Richard Steel
“Opportunities for photographing birds with a wide angle lens are infrequent, so when I encountered some confiding puffins on Hornøya Island off northern Norway, I decided to take some shots.”

title: Javan Hawk Eagle by Irawan Subingar
text:
Javan Hawk Eagle by Irawan Subingar
“The Javan Hawk Eagle is the national bird of Indonesia and is commonly called Garuda, from the bird-like creatures in Hindu and Buddhist myths. It is one of the rarest raptors and is on the Endangered species list.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full. 
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: If Only I Could Escape by Aaron Fuhrman
text:
If Only I Could Escape by Aaron Fuhrman
“A slow moving weather system with a well defined front line moved past and began to engulf us. I took to the back roads to capture the mood. The outstretched road leads to a fleeting window of clear skies beyond.”

title: Kermit by Jeff Morgan
text:
Kermit by Jeff Morgan
“Taken in early June in French countryside near Crozant, this is the time of the year for frogs to announce their presence. I lay down and crawled to the pond keeping my camera as low to the water as possible.”

title: Tuscany – Light and Shadows by Irca Calikas
text:
Tuscany – Light and Shadows by Irca Calikas
“This is Crete Sienesi, Tuscany, early in the morning when the light is soft. I’ve visited this area many times, and it is often difficult to find the right location and light, but on this occasion it was perfect.”

title: Le Port d’Essaouria by Ivo Berg
text:
Le Port d’Essaouria by Ivo Berg
“I love travel photography. The port of Essaouira, Morocco certainly was one of the most lively and vibrant places I have ever been to. Just recently I started an adventurous photography journey through South East Asia. Follow the adventure here”

title: The Hungry Caterpillar by Charlotte Gravatt
text:
The Hungry Caterpillar by Charlotte Gravatt
“When taking ‘Plantlife' photos for an Online Weekly Project Group, I stumbled upon this tiny caterpillar on some 'sticky weed’ in the hedgerow. If I wasn’t looking through the macro lens I may have missed it!”

title: Little Tarn by Perri Schelat
text:
Little Tarn by Perri Schelat
“This is Mount Kidd in Alberta, Canada. I used a three-stop graduated neutral density filter to hold back the brightness of the sky and mountain , and a polariser to reduce reflection.”

title: Ring-necked Duck by Tim King
text:
Ring-necked Duck by Tim King
“I took this in April at a small pond in southern Ontario, Canada, arriving before sunrise to find a perfect spot where the sun would be at my back. I was fully camouflaged in the cattails with my decoy ducks.”

title: Porth Nanven by Julian Harrison-Jones
text:
Porth Nanven by Julian Harrison-Jones
“Porth Nanven is a Cornish beach comprised of thousands of ‘dinosaur eggs’ –weathered stones over 100,000 years old that range from a few centimetres to a metre in size. Over time they have been shaped by the waves.”

title: See Them Play by Didan Rachmat
text:
See Them Play by Didan Rachmat
“One fine morning at a village. Lucky me to catch their happy expressions, curves that heal the world.”

title: Star Star by Eve North
text:
Star Star by Eve North
“This is myself and my little dog taken at a lake at nightfall in September. It was an Indian summer and the night was balmy and warm.”

title: Giallo e Verde by Massimo Feliziani
text:
Giallo e Verde by Massimo Feliziani
“I took this picture in the Marche region of Italy. During this period, spring explodes with a thousand colors. I got up very early on a beautiful April day as weather promised to be good for a photo shoot.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Hooverphonic by Romain Ballez
text:
Hooverphonic by Romain Ballez
“This is a picture of Noémie Wolfs from the Belgian band Hooverphonic, taken in front of the Royal Palace, Brussels in early May during the Irisfeest.”

title: Batubolong Temple by Didan Rachmat
text:
Batubolong Temple by Didan Rachmat
“I was hoping for a low tide so I could go down and shot the rocks from the other side, but as the tide was high I instead captured this sunset view from a distance.”

title: The Three Sisters by Michael James
text:
The Three Sisters by Michael James
“A group of us often head out to the mountains in the fall to shoot the amazing colours. This was the last morning and the last frame I shot before packing it in for that location. Three Sisters is a mountain range that overlooks Canmore, Alberta, Canada.“

title: The First Mate by Joseph Corrado
text:
The First Mate by Joseph Corrado
“This was taken aboard the Schooner Olad out of Camden, Maine. It started out sunny, but we were soon engulfed in thick fog. The first mate, pictured here, was responsible for forward outlook duties.”

title: Sunset Reflection of Chobe by Mario Moreno
text:
Sunset Reflection of Chobe by Mario Moreno
“Elephants grazing at sunset in Chobe National Park in Botswana. This is just one of the many islands that appears when the Chobe river is at its highest level.”

title: On Cloud 9 by Thai Pham
text:
On Cloud 9 by Thai Pham
“This was taken in the morning near the entrance of the Flower Fields in Carlsbad, California. I saw this bed of African lilies and spent 30 minutes photographing them, so I knew my shot of the season would come from this!”

title: Wet by Charlotte Gravatt
text:
Wet by Charlotte Gravatt
“Dandelion seed heads are everywhere at this time of year, but it wasn’t until I looked closely that I saw they really are quite magical. I took this shot after the spring rain had stopped falling!”

title: Tiny Jumping Spider by David La Mason
text:
Tiny Jumping Spider by David La Mason
“I had originally set out to capture damselflies and dragonflies, but I was more than thrilled to find this tiny jumping spider sitting on the edge of a yellow iris petal, taking small hops in a circle.”

title: Indio by Marco Rank
text:
Indio by Marco Rank
“Processing character portraits requires you to know your subject’s personality and the unique story of their life. By using a full frame camera and lenses with fixed focal lengths at wide aperture, I tried to control the depth of field.”

title: Marbled White by Tim Tapley
text:
Marbled White by Tim Tapley
“On Salisbury Plain shortly before dusk on what had been a sunny evening, many butterflies began to look for somewhere to settle for the night,  and the opportunity arose to capture this marbled white at rest.”

title: Canada Goose Gosling by Jessica Kirste
text:
Canada Goose Gosling by Jessica Kirste
On my walk to the river I came across a family of Canada geese. The yellow and brown fuzz will sometimes have a light green tint so they blend in with the grasses. Nature’s design always amazes me!

title: Misty Sunrise by Robert Lachaine
text:
Misty Sunrise by Robert Lachaine
“I got up very early hoping to catch the sun rise over one of the lakes in Algonquin Park in Ontario. I spotted this scene as I came over the crest of a hill, so stopped to take this shot.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Frog by Irawan Subingar
text:
Frog by Irawan Subingar
“While taking photos of other animals, I saw this strong silhouette of a tree frog and felt compelled to this this picture.”

title: Coomenoole Beach by Shane Turner
text:
Coomenoole Beach by Shane Turner
“Coomenoole Beach is situated on the Dingle Peninsula on the west coast of Ireland. It’s a surfer’s paradise. I took this shot on a wet and windy evening just above the sea cliff as the sun dipped below the horizon.”

title: Emperor of the Golden Fields by Neer Ildiko
text:
Emperor of the Golden Fields by Neer Ildiko
“I took this shot while on a trip to Őrség, Hungary. I went into a large field there each  evening to try to capture the atmosphere of the field as the sun set. I took this picture on one such evening.”

title: Sunset at Pushkar by Nimit Nigam
text:
Sunset at Pushkar by Nimit Nigam
“This was taken at Camel Pushkar Fair in Rajasthan in November 2012, the world’s biggest camel trade fair. I saw people doing a photo shoot with these camels. I loved how they were silhouetted, so I took this shot.”

title: Farmer’s Daughter by Ian Pettigrew
text:
Farmer’s Daughter by Ian Pettigrew
“This was taken at a rural farm in Fisherville, Ontario for Canadian fashion magazine ACF. It was a challenging shoot due to extreme winds and temperatures of about –5 Celsius. The model was a real trooper!”

title: Mallard Hatchlings by Cindy Bryant
text:
Mallard Hatchlings by Cindy Bryant
“My family and I witnessed mallard hatchlings overcome the mountainous neighbourhood terrain crossing the road. Attracting a small crowd, the mamma mallard stood close by to make sure all babies were accounted for before returning to the water.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full. 
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine! Our special thanks this week to Jacky Parker, Steve Docwra and Sean Foo.

title: Baltimore Oriole by Raymond Barlow
text:
Baltimore Oriole by Raymond Barlow
“I host photo tours in Costa Rica. This shot was taken on one such tour while we were staying at a coffee farm in the cloud forests of San Jose.”

title: Secret Marsh by Katherine Gendreau
text:
Secret Marsh by Katherine Gendreau
”I photographed this marsh in Kittery, Maine using a Hoya R72 infrared filter. I used a long exposure to create motion blur in the clouds as they moved over the marsh.”

title: Goodbye Cruel World… by Salah Baazizi
text:
Goodbye Cruel World… by Salah Baazizi
“This rock dove (or pigeon) landed next to me on the bridge at Bolsa Chica Ecological Reserve in California. As they live under the bridge, instead of taking to the sky like most birds, it dived down.”

title: Balconies by Mark Coe
text:
Balconies by Mark Coe
”This is a shot of the balconies of a new development of apartments along the seafront in Chalkwell Southend-On-Sea, England. They really stand out as the building is flanked by other dull-looking apartment blocks, so they have become something of a local landmark.”

title: Fascinating Beauty by Andrea Rapisarda
text:
Fascinating Beauty by Andrea Rapisarda
”I took this shot at the Rome Photoshow in March 2012. This beautiful model was posing on Sony’s stand at the event.”

title: Booted Warbler by Niranj Vaidyanathan
text:
Booted Warbler by Niranj Vaidyanathan
”To photograph this warbler, I lay on the ground at an angle that favoured good light and a background that would give me a good bokeh, and moved in closer along on the ground to avoid alert the bird.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page.
Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full. Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine! Our special thanks this week to Fredy Mihaila, Yuga Kurita and Daniel Enderle.

title: Elisabetta by Paolo Mezzera
text:
Elisabetta by Paolo Mezzera
”Elisabetta is 13-years-old and from Italy. This image is part of a series of of shots published on my website. Usually I dislike black and white conversions, but in this case I really love how it works.”

title: The Sagrada Família by Daniel Borg
text:
The Sagrada Família by Daniel Borg
”The architecture and attention to detail in the building of The Sagrada Família is simply beautiful and I wanted to convey that beauty in one image. To capture this I used an Ultra Wide Angle lens.”

title: Hello Morning! by Celeste Mookherjee
text:
Hello Morning! by Celeste Mookherjee
”I love photographing morning glories because they can appear lit from within. When one is out of macro reach, I often switch to a zoom lens, which I did for this photograph.”

title: Midnight Reflections by Matthew Bleakley
text:
Midnight Reflections by Matthew Bleakley
“A pallid bat skims across a pond in southern Arizona. The yellow on the wings is pollen picked up by the bat. Off-camera flashes were fired using a custom-built infra-red trigger.”

title: Gelato by Kristina Kurtze
text:
Gelato by Kristina Kurtze
”This photo is of gelato with a candied orange slice. I used a Nikon SB800 with an umbrella to the right of the gelato and a reflector behind it and slightly to the left, angled towards the flash.”

title: Black Grouse by David Newby
text:
Black Grouse by David Newby
“This image of a male black grouse was taken on a private estate in the Yorkshire Dales, UK, in March 2012. After a very early start on a misty morning, the sun came out, and so did the grouse.”

title: The Big Eye by Vincent Bourrut
text:
The Big Eye by Vincent Bourrut
“This is the spiral staircase at Heal’s department store in London. I knew the picture I wanted to take – my aim was to bring out the detail in the wood.”

title: Sapa, Vietnam by Diego Arroyo
text:
Sapa, Vietnam by Diego Arroyo
“I took this shot of a Hmong woman in a rice field in the region of Sapa, in north Vietnam.”

title: By adegsm
text:
By adegsm
This unusual shot anthropomorphises the insects: positioned as they are, you can’t help but see them as two lovers, gazing into each other’s beady eyes, sitting in a romantic location atop a flower.

title: Schafsteize by Walter Hupfer
text:
Schafsteize by Walter Hupfer
“When I was out walking my dogs, we were observed suspiciously by a blue-headed wagtail, which was probably guarding its nest. When it perched on a stalk of wheat, I took this photo.”

title: The Sky’s The Limit by Yosuke Kobayashi
text:
The Sky’s The Limit by Yosuke Kobayashi
“These buildings stand at the southern end of Manhattan. The tallest you can see here is One World Trade Center, which is under construction.”

title: Alone by Natasha Palmer
text:
Alone by Natasha Palmer
“This image represents someone being abandoned. The Princess Bride by William Golman inspired the costume and the location. I darkened the image in Photoshop and added the rays of light.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Richard by Matthew Davis
text:
Richard by Matthew Davis
“While walking around the streets of Tulsa, Oklahoma, I ran into this man named Richard. He and I had a long talk that included a number of life lessons. He was a very encouraging man.”

title: Pandora by Yury Pustovoy
text:
Pandora by Yury Pustovoy
“I took this in Wulingyuan, in China’s Hunan Province. This is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where quartzite sandstone pillars – some over 800 metres high – tower into the sky.”

title: Devil’s Bridge by Marcel Fischer
text:
Devil’s Bridge by Marcel Fischer
“This is the Devil’s Bridge in the small town of Bobbio, in Piacenza, northern Italy. The bridge is the landmark of the town, which looks very picturesque in the evening light.”

title: When In Fiji by Sarah Lee
text:
When In Fiji by Sarah Lee
“Alison Teal, a surfer and filmmaker, dives beneath a surfer in Fiji. We spent a few hours in the water dodging surfers and big waves, and got this right before being called back to the boat.”

title: A Snowy Morning by Josh Clark
text:
A Snowy Morning by Josh Clark
“I photographed this snowy owl during a two-day excursion to Damon Point, Washington. The sun was just coming over the horizon as I snapped him perched atop of a piece of driftwood.”

title: Union Terrace Swimmers’ Pier At Sunrise by Cassius Callender
text:
Union Terrace Swimmers’ Pier At Sunrise by Cassius Callender
“I took this shot of Lake Medota in Madison, Wisconsin at 5:24am. It was a calm morning with just a touch of fog, which appeared to blend lake and sky. The clouds give a sense of viewing the Earth from above.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full. 
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine! Our special thanks this week to Sean Foo, Lisabella Photographie, Maxime Dugenet, Sarah M, and Adam Levy.

title: This Is Not Me by Sabina Miklowitz
text:
This Is Not Me by Sabina Miklowitz
“For this self-portrait, I used Photoshop to see how glamorous I could make myself look. It disturbed me to see how many of my friends were unaware how much of it had been retouched.”

title: Eyes Front by Uda Dennie
text:
Eyes Front by Uda Dennie
“This is a damselfly perched on a reed near my home on Batam Island, Indonesia. I crouched down and took this shot face-on to the insect.”

title: The Shape of Light XI – Shell Haus, Berlin by Joel Tjintjelaar
text:
The Shape of Light XI – Shell Haus, Berlin by Joel Tjintjelaar
“This photo is part of an award-winning series of five. I used to ND filters here, which together added up to 16 stops, to extend the exposure time dramatically.”

title: Hello Morning! by Celeste Mookherjee
text:
Hello Morning! by Celeste Mookherjee
“I love photographing morning glories because they can appear lit from within. When one is out of macro reach, I often turn to a zoom lens as I did here. (Olympus E-510, 70-300mm zoom, f/5.2, 1/1000, ISO 100, handheld.)”

title: Rainbow Water Balloon II by Ryan Taylor
text:
Rainbow Water Balloon II by Ryan Taylor
“This image show six water balloons being shot with a pellet gun. I created the colour by adding a few drops of food colouring to the water in the balloons, and used a sound trigger for the flashes.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Landscape Photography by Rudolf Vicek
text:
Landscape Photography by Rudolf Vicek
“This was taken near the town of Klatovy in the Pilsen region of the Czech Republic. I heavily edited this shot in Photoshop, creating the motion blur in the foreground and sky.”

title: Intense Look by Dinesh Babu
text:
Intense Look by Dinesh Babu
“As this boy looked out of the window, he gave me an intense stare. I thought it would make a superb image, and I didn’t hesitate to take the picture.”

title: Moment in the Sun by Jo Goodman
text:
Moment in the Sun by Jo Goodman
“This was taken on a sunny and cloudy day in early June. I saw a sea thrift above me on some rocks as the sun came out and took a couple of shots. I later processed it using Adobe Lightroom.” – Jo Goodman

title: Le Mont Saint Michele by David Martin Castan
text:
Le Mont Saint Michele by David Martin Castan
“I had dreamed of this picture for years. I put the ISO up high in order to reveal the stars, but this resulted in the lights of the building burning out, so I used a filter to prevent this.”

title: The Blackout by Laura Palmer
text:
The Blackout by Laura Palmer
“This is a shot of Gavin Butler, from the band The Blackout, doing a scissor kick during a live show at Bristol’s 02 Academy in the UK."

title: Sadhu by Mohan Duwal
text:
Sadhu by Mohan Duwal
“In Hinduism, a sadhu is a wandering monk. As a sadhu, this man has renounced a ‘normal’ life to focus on pursuing his spirituality.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Pleasantly Plump Pouches by Barb D'Arpino
text:
Pleasantly Plump Pouches by Barb D'Arpino
“Meet Eleanor the eastern chipmunk. I took this a few days after she had emerged from her burrow this spring, stuffing peanuts into her cheeks, emptying them, and repeating.”

title: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle by Leonardo Caforio
text:
Reduce, Reuse, Recycle by Leonardo Caforio
“I photographed my Uncle Armando, 93, in his workshop in Sava, south Italy, where he has worked since he was 12 years old. He earns his living from repairing agricultural tools.”

title: Woodpecker and Scarlet Elf Cup by Keith Bannister
text:
Woodpecker and Scarlet Elf Cup by Keith Bannister
“This was taken from a hide at a small feed station I set up. At first the woodpeckers were quite shy, but as long as I was quiet, they eventually came down to feed.”

title: The Mystery of Peace by Keyvan Hami
text:
The Mystery of Peace by Keyvan Hami
“It was a cold and foggy winter evening, and the water was calm on Lake Tahoe as this man punted across the water. In spite of the fog, the mountains were still visible on the horizon.”

title: Crete Senesi by Jaroslaw Pawlak
text:
Crete Senesi by Jaroslaw Pawlak
“I took this picture in Crete Senesi in Tuscany, Italy. I like to photograph this place at any time of the year, as there are always beautiful light patterns on the waves of the hills."

title: 300 Seconds by Anthony Ko
text:
300 Seconds by Anthony Ko
“The shot was taken at sunset, at Lake Wanaka in New Zealand. I used a polarising filter to enhance the contrast in the sky, and a 6-stop neutral density filter to increase the duration of the exposure.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Our Cousins by Juan Luis Duran
text:
Our Cousins by Juan Luis Duran
“I took this at the Bioparc zoo in Valencia, Spain, where you can observe the animals closely. Looking at the faces and behaviour of the gorillas, it is easy to conclude that they are our cousins.”

title: Rooftop by Alle Dicu
text:
Rooftop by Alle Dicu
“This was taken in July last year. I was heavy-hearted at the time, so I summoned three buddies to join me on the rooftop. I brought the colourful blankets and they brought the good vibes.”

title: Nadya by Stanislav Puchkovsky
text:
Nadya by Stanislav Puchkovsky
“I took this photograph last summer. As the weather was nice, Nadya and I went to the countryside to take pictures outside. This shot is one of the most popular images I’ve ever taken.”

title: Closing In by Benjeev Rendhava
text:
Closing In by Benjeev Rendhava
“This is near Marienplatz in Munich, Germany. The area was heaving with people, yet this street remained peaceful. I used a wide angle lens to emphasise the cobblestones, and set a long exposure.”

title: Fanad Lighthouse, Rainbow’s End by Stephen Emerson
text:
Fanad Lighthouse, Rainbow’s End by Stephen Emerson
“On my way to Fanad Head, County Donegal, Ireland. I could see the potential for a rainbow as the sun started to break through. I used a graduated filter and a polariser to enhance the colours."

title: Strawberry Splash by Levente Bodo
text:
Strawberry Splash by Levente Bodo
“I’d been planning to take this shot for a while. The concept was to create a wonderful splash, like a wave hitting rocks. I used an umbrella to soften the light and shot in manual mode.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Follow the Light in Kijal by Melvin Tong
text:
Follow the Light in Kijal by Melvin Tong
“I took this shot late in the afternoon, but the sunlight was still too bright behind me. To counter this I used a 10-stop ND filter to prolong the exposure and smooth out the water.” – Melvin Tong

title: Musk Ox by James Morgan
text:
Musk Ox by James Morgan
“The musk ox is a hardy animal capable of enduring very harsh winters. I took this image in Dovrefjell-Sunndalsfjella National Park in Norway, where they were reintroduced in 1932."

title: Vivid Vision by Dylan Fox
text:
Vivid Vision by Dylan Fox
“Rottnest Island is a brilliant holiday spot just off Western Australia and provides some awesome photographic opportunity. This was taken as the sun set over the bay. The colours were spectacular!”

title: Clearing Storm on the Palouse by Steve Kidd
text:
Clearing Storm on the Palouse by Steve Kidd
“This was taken in the Palouse region in Washington state, in the US. We drove up to Steptoe Butte, the highest feature in the area, to set up for sunset. A storm arrived as the sun was setting.”

title: Chelsea by Joel Bedford
text:
Chelsea by Joel Bedford
“This was shot using one umbrella and a reflector. It was taken for a local magazine, but this edit was my own personal remix for my portfolio. There was a substantial amount of retouching involved.”

title: Sandstorm in a Masai Village by Simon Powell
text:
Sandstorm in a Masai Village by Simon Powell
“This was taken in Kenya, while visiting a Masai village in Tsavo East National Park. The Masai warriors were happy for us to take photographs, and shortly after our arrival a sandstorm blew up.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: By Sudharshun Gopalan
text:
By Sudharshun Gopalan
“This was taken on a photo walk on the streets of Chennai, India. I thought the way the light shone on the faces of these men was very artistic, so I took the opportunity to grab a quick shot.”

title: Santorini by Daniel Rericha
text:
Santorini by Daniel Rericha
“An evening shot of the village of Oia, on the island of Santorini, in Greece. I like the fact the lights are just starting to come on across the village.”

title: Grazing Sheep by Florent Courty
text:
Grazing Sheep by Florent Courty
“This was shot in La Chaine des Puys, a volcanic region in France’s Massif Central. During summer this is a very traditional scene. The finished image is a blend of five different exposures.”

title: Neist Point by Nicolas Rottiers
text:
Neist Point by Nicolas Rottiers
“It was a race against time on the winding Scottish roads to capture what I was waiting for. After a few days of braving the rain and fog on the Isle of Skye, the magical light suddenly appeared.”

title: Rossbeigh Sunbeam Shipwreck, Ireland by Shane Turner
text:
Rossbeigh Sunbeam Shipwreck, Ireland by Shane Turner
“The Sunbeam was a schooner built in England in the 1860s – caught in a gale, she ran aground on Rossbeigh Beach in 1903. Storm-force winds have now unearthed her from the sand.”

title: Hawaiian Light by Craig Parry
text:
Hawaiian Light by Craig Parry
“This was captured on the west side of Oahu Island, Hawaii. The late afternoon storm and sunset helped to back-light the wave and create the rainbow sitting prominently in the background.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Mary Elizabeth by Eduardo Izquierdo
text:
Mary Elizabeth by Eduardo Izquierdo
“This picture is from my project titled ‘Unusually Natural’, a series of minimal, natural portraits exploring feminine beauty. The girl in the picture is Mary Elizabeth, a dancer at Indiana University.”

title: Dos años después by Iñaki de Luis
text:
Dos años después by Iñaki de Luis
“Two years ago I took a shot in Donostia, Spain of my son looking out toward the horizon. I recently came back to the same place and took a shot with my children to capture how quickly time passes.” – Iñaki de Luis

title: Cyanea capillata by Alexander Semenov
text:
Cyanea capillata by Alexander Semenov
This beautiful image of a Lion’s mane jellyfish has an almost supernatural quality. Being light from beneath beautifully shows off the intricate detail of the animal, which is further assisted by the composition.

title: Monk’s Hand by Diego Arroyo
text:
Monk’s Hand by Diego Arroyo
“I took this shot of Buddhist monks meditating early in the morning in Angkor, Cambodia.” – Diego

title: Lifting the Veil by Michael Bollino
text:
Lifting the Veil by Michael Bollino
“This was taken at Paradise Meadows, Mount Rainier National Park, Washington State. It’s famous for its wildflower display each August. I waited over 48 hours for the clouds to clear."

title: Jellyfish by Steven Xue
text:
Jellyfish by Steven Xue
“This was taken during a visit to the Shedd Aquarium in Chicago. Jellyfish are mostly transparent, and as they were under great lighting here, it made them very photogenic."

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Emperor Penguin by Jeff Rose
text:
Emperor Penguin by Jeff Rose
“My wife, Kalitha, and I photographed these beautiful Emperor penguins. The lone penguin in front really embodied the name of the species with his royal pose, helping to create a great focal point and strong composition."

title: First Light by Michael Hindman
text:
First Light by Michael Hindman
This superbly composed shot uses the rock in the foreground to guide your eye through the image to the main subject matter; the large rock positioned neatly off-centre.

title: Winter Nubble Light by Moe Chen
text:
Winter Nubble Light by Moe Chen
“First shot from this morning’s Nubble light shoot. The color balance seems a little bit off with the purple tones on the foreground and the blues in the sky. I tried for a long time trying to "correct” this until I realized it was a simple matter of the fact that the sky is natural, the foreground is being lit by what amounts to a giant red burning flare…“View more of Moe’s photography at his website.

title: View From Tent by Artur Debat Molleví
text:
View From Tent by Artur Debat Molleví
“This was taken in the Valh d'Aran in the north of Catalonia in the Pyrenees, Spain. I went trekking there during the summer, where I camped and took this picture."

title: Raam by Balaji Maheshwar
text:
Raam by Balaji Maheshwar
This colourful portrait was taken in Mylapore, Chennai, India. The black background eliminates distractions and allows the bright and varied colours to take centre stage. In sharp focus, and making great use of light and shadow, Balaji has created an impressive portrait.

title: The Abstract Tree by Andre Ermolaev
text:
The Abstract Tree by Andre Ermolaev
“This was taken from the window of a plane over the southern coast of Iceland. The river flows into a lake across dark volcanic sand, creating complicated patterns. This image is composed of seven separate images stitched together.” – Andre Ermolaev

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: By Pysixx
text:
By Pysixx
This image uses a narrow aperture, lightly textured background, and soft colour palette to create an unusual fine-art flower photograph.

title: Rays by Marcin Sobas
text:
Rays by Marcin Sobas
“This photo was taken in August 2009, in the Beskidy Mountains in Poland. It was the start of a hot day, and a low fog hung in the valley. As the sun rose it lit the valley, creating an amazing scene.” – Marcin

title: Drom by Johannes Heuckeroth
text:
Drom by Johannes Heuckeroth
“This image shows the Tempodrom building in Berlin, Germany. To get the most out of its architecture, I took five portrait-format wide-angle photos and stitched them together.” – Johannes

title: Inupiat Elder by Clark Mishler
text:
Inupiat Elder by Clark Mishler
Inupiat elder and natural sciences advisor Kenny Toovak, with fur ruff, on the coast of the Arctic Ocean near Barrow, Alaska.

title: Young Male Merlin by Claire Marshall
text:
Young Male Merlin by Claire Marshall
“I took this image on a bird-of-prey workshop at Sutton Bank in Yorkshire, UK. The light and location were spot on, and this little bird posed happily for photographers and assembled onlookers!” – Claire

title: Lea Jones with ‘Cricket’, a four-year-old Chihuahua-Miniature Pinscher cross, and Stacey Scott with 'Bono’, a four-year-old Chihuahua-Shih Tzu cross.
text:
